Fall and winter are seasons of transition; not just in weather, but in style. As the temperature changes, the cold snap requires our wardrobes to adapt. Which, for the record, is totally a good thing. This season, fashion for men is a delightful blend of the classic and the unexpected, from rodeo-ready looks to outfits your grandpa would love. So, whether you’re looking to step up your style for work, or just trying to stay toasty with taste, take note of these five fall/winter 2024 trends that’ll keep you ahead of the curve. In This ArticleOur PicksFinal Thoughts ralphlauren / Instagram Westernwear: Saddle Up, Cowboy The wild, wild West is back—if it even left. Think cowboy boots, rugged denim shirts, and statement buckle belts that Billy the Kid would be proud of. Better yet, there’s no saddle sore or filling water buckets at 5am. How to Wear It: Start small by adding a denim shirt over a basic graphic tee, paired with classic blue jeans. Upgrade your footwear with cowboy boots but swerve the spurs. Finish with a statement belt buckle. It’s bold, it’s big, and it instantly ups your outfit’s attitude. Westernwear can be surprisingly versatile, especially when you mix and match these pieces with more minimalist staples. This trend is your shortcut to looking effortlessly cool—because let’s face it, who doesn’t want to be a cowboy? Big Overcoats: The Oversized Takeover This winter, the bigger the better—at least when it comes to overcoats. Oversized outerwear was everywhere on the runways, which is great news for keeping warm. Key Styles to Look Out For: Boxy overcoats in neutral tones like camel, charcoal, and navy are endlessly versatile. If you’re feeling bolder, try a patterned or checkered coat—it’s a surefire way to turn heads in the right way. Pay attention to textures like wool or tweed; they not only look good but also feel like a warm hug when it’s needed most. Styling Tip: Balance out the volume of an oversized coat with more tailored pieces underneath—think fitted trousers or slim jeans. Textures: Get Cozy with Corduroy, Suede, and Mohair This season is all about textures that invite touch. From corduroy jackets to suede pants and mohair cardigans, mixing different materials adds depth to your outfit. Texture play isn’t just for the tactile joy—it’s also an easy way to elevate even the simplest fits. Trending Pieces: Corduroy jackets in rich, earthy tones like rust, olive, or burgundy are making waves. They’re the perfect layering piece, adding a little throwback vibe to your ensemble. Suede pants (hell yeah) can be surprisingly versatile. Pair them with chunky knits or a leather jacket for a luxe touch. Mohair sweaters or cardigans bring an extra layer of warmth and softness that’s perfect for this season. Pro Tip: When playing with textures, keep your color palette muted to let the fabric speak for itself. Grandpacore: The Ultimate Nod to Nostalgia Dressing like your grandpa isn’t just cool, it’s practical. Think cable knit sweaters, shawl-collar cardigans, and pleated khakis. These pieces are timeless, offering a sense of comfort and nostalgia while still looking fresh when styled right. Essentials for Your Wardrobe: A cable knit sweater will be your go-to layering piece. Perfect over a crisp button-up or even under that oversized coat you’ll be buying. Shawl-collar cardigans bring a certain scholarly vibe to your fit—ideal for coffee shop hangs or casual Fridays at the office. Don’t sleep on pleated khakis. Yes, they’re all the rage, but with a twist. Opt for a classic or loose fit to keep it current. Grandpacore offers the best of both worlds: classic comfort with a contemporary edge. You’ll look like you know what you’re doing without trying too hard. Ties: The Return of the Formal Accessory Just when you thought that ties were dead and buried, they’re back in a big way. Designers have brought ties out of the corporate corner and back into the everyday fashion lexicon. Whether it’s for a business meeting or a more casual event, the tie is no longer reserved for stuffy occasions. How to Make It Work: Experiment with textured ties: wool, knit, or silk blends in rich colors that complement your cold-weather wardrobe. Don’t be afraid to pair a tie with something less formal. A tie and shirt with a cardigan creates an interesting juxtaposition between smart and casual. The power suit + tie combo is, of course, never going out of style. But this season, take inspiration from Valentino and try layering a turtleneck under a shirt. Ties are officially cool again, and they’re an easy way to inject a bit of formality and flair into your fall/winter fits. You’ll look polished without looking like you just came from the office—a balance that’s worth mastering. wrangler / Instagram Final Thoughts This season’s trends offer a little bit of everything: rugged Western vibes, oversized comfort, tactile textures, and nostalgic nods to simpler times. And let’s not forget about the humble tie, which has officially reclaimed its place in the modern man’s wardrobe. Whether you’re going full cowboy or embracing grandpa chic, there’s plenty to experiment with. Billy is a content specialist and social media manager. Fall and winter are seasons of transition; not just in weather, but in style. As the temperature changes, the cold snap requires our wardrobes to adapt. Which, for the record, is totally a good thing.

This season, fashion for men is a delightful blend of the classic and the unexpected, from rodeo-ready looks to outfits your grandpa would love. So, whether you’re looking to step up your style for work, or just trying to stay toasty with taste, take note of these five fall/winter 2024 trends that’ll keep you ahead of the curve.


In This Article

  1. Our Picks
  2. Final Thoughts

Westernwear: Saddle Up, Cowboy

The wild, wild West is back—if it even left. Think cowboy boots, rugged denim shirts, and statement buckle belts that Billy the Kid would be proud of. Better yet, there’s no saddle sore or filling water buckets at 5am.

How to Wear It:

  • Start small by adding a denim shirt over a basic graphic tee, paired with classic blue jeans.
  • Upgrade your footwear with cowboy boots but swerve the spurs.
  • Finish with a statement belt buckle. It’s bold, it’s big, and it instantly ups your outfit’s attitude.

Westernwear can be surprisingly versatile, especially when you mix and match these pieces with more minimalist staples. This trend is your shortcut to looking effortlessly cool—because let’s face it, who doesn’t want to be a cowboy?

Big Overcoats: The Oversized Takeover

This winter, the bigger the better—at least when it comes to overcoats. Oversized outerwear was everywhere on the runways, which is great news for keeping warm.

Key Styles to Look Out For:

  • Boxy overcoats in neutral tones like camel, charcoal, and navy are endlessly versatile.
  • If you’re feeling bolder, try a patterned or checkered coat—it’s a surefire way to turn heads in the right way.
  • Pay attention to textures like wool or tweed; they not only look good but also feel like a warm hug when it’s needed most.

Styling Tip: Balance out the volume of an oversized coat with more tailored pieces underneath—think fitted trousers or slim jeans.

Textures: Get Cozy with Corduroy, Suede, and Mohair

This season is all about textures that invite touch. From corduroy jackets to suede pants and mohair cardigans, mixing different materials adds depth to your outfit. Texture play isn’t just for the tactile joy—it’s also an easy way to elevate even the simplest fits.

Trending Pieces:

  • Corduroy jackets in rich, earthy tones like rust, olive, or burgundy are making waves. They’re the perfect layering piece, adding a little throwback vibe to your ensemble.
  • Suede pants (hell yeah) can be surprisingly versatile. Pair them with chunky knits or a leather jacket for a luxe touch.
  • Mohair sweaters or cardigans bring an extra layer of warmth and softness that’s perfect for this season.

Pro Tip: When playing with textures, keep your color palette muted to let the fabric speak for itself.

Grandpacore: The Ultimate Nod to Nostalgia

Dressing like your grandpa isn’t just cool, it’s practical. Think cable knit sweaters, shawl-collar cardigans, and pleated khakis. These pieces are timeless, offering a sense of comfort and nostalgia while still looking fresh when styled right.

Essentials for Your Wardrobe:

  • A cable knit sweater will be your go-to layering piece. Perfect over a crisp button-up or even under that oversized coat you’ll be buying.
  • Shawl-collar cardigans bring a certain scholarly vibe to your fit—ideal for coffee shop hangs or casual Fridays at the office.
  • Don’t sleep on pleated khakis. Yes, they’re all the rage, but with a twist. Opt for a classic or loose fit to keep it current.

Grandpacore offers the best of both worlds: classic comfort with a contemporary edge. You’ll look like you know what you’re doing without trying too hard.

Ties: The Return of the Formal Accessory

Just when you thought that ties were dead and buried, they’re back in a big way. Designers have brought ties out of the corporate corner and back into the everyday fashion lexicon. Whether it’s for a business meeting or a more casual event, the tie is no longer reserved for stuffy occasions.

How to Make It Work:

  • Experiment with textured ties: wool, knit, or silk blends in rich colors that complement your cold-weather wardrobe.
  • Don’t be afraid to pair a tie with something less formal. A tie and shirt with a cardigan creates an interesting juxtaposition between smart and casual.
  • The power suit + tie combo is, of course, never going out of style. But this season, take inspiration from Valentino and try layering a turtleneck under a shirt.

Ties are officially cool again, and they’re an easy way to inject a bit of formality and flair into your fall/winter fits. You’ll look polished without looking like you just came from the office—a balance that’s worth mastering.

Final Thoughts

This season’s trends offer a little bit of everything: rugged Western vibes, oversized comfort, tactile textures, and nostalgic nods to simpler times. And let’s not forget about the humble tie, which has officially reclaimed its place in the modern man’s wardrobe. Whether you’re going full cowboy or embracing grandpa chic, there’s plenty to experiment with.

Billy is a content specialist and social media manager. His portfolio includes articles for publications such as British GQ, Esquire and Men’s Health. A self-confessed lover of luxury streetwear, he admits to an unhealthy obsession for baseball caps and high-end sneakers.
